messages.message:
Hey, how can I get notified when AI Hub UI changes are made (both internally facing as an SE and externally as a customer)? I just ran a demo and in the hour between my dry run and the demo the UI changed which meant I had to explore on the fly. Do customers get notified of changes so they don't get confused or lost with product updates?

I also made a bunch of enablement videos this morning which are probably out of date now :melting_face:

yah this is an interesting issue. We do have 2-4 weeks of flags before we add a feature to GA but if customers never opt in to new features then it would feel like they are thrusted with new features. I do think most features are small enough that we don't need to make an announcement for them though.
Would be good to maybe send an email out with new features + upcoming changes?
in theory we do have announcements like these in <#C03N2DF2FT4|> with every release, but i suppose we don't always announce UI changes
Yes please! Especially as we start to record Scribes & Videos

I'm imagining a `See what's new` pop-up (_that and/or tiny overlay element/pointer_), or

`Things have moved around`  (`See what's new`)
Yah, I think internally we need to be better at announcing features in <#C03N2DF2FT4|> but we do need to better announce to customers I bet
Doing the popup for every change doesn't seem needed. Things like that are meant for larger changes
to be clearâ€”is the question here about new _features_, or just UI changes? because the initial message seems to be about just UI changes; there are no actual new features
Yeh I hadn't seen them in that channel. ideally it would be 24hrs before and say what time you will see changes in the product to be aware for demos
Both - product updates that affect the usual way we work with AI Hub (UI or new features appearing)
We typically send out emails announcing new features prior to the release cc @Ram Prasanna
